paper_abstract: The k-feedback arc set problem is to determine whether there is a set F of at most k arcs in a directed graph G such that the removal of F makes G acyclic. The k-feedback arc set problems in tournaments and bipartite tournaments (k-FAST and k-FASBT) have applications in ranking aggregation and have been extensively studied from the viewpoint of parameterized complexity. By introducing a new concept called "bimodule", we provide a problem kernel with O(k (2)) vertices for k-FASBT, which improves the previous result by a factor of k.
paper_title: A Quadratic Vertex Kernel for Feedback Arc Set in Bipartite Tournaments
